Mission 15: Pronoun Mastery

Identify and Use All Pronouns Correctly

Hunter Hyro, this is the ultimate challenge - complete mastery of ALL pronoun types!

FINAL BOSS: THE PRONOUN GAUNTLET

9 worksheets stand between you and S-Rank Language Arts mastery. Conquer them all!

The Challenge Awaits

This is your final test, Hunter. You must demonstrate complete mastery of all pronoun types: subjective, objective, possessive, reflexive, and intensive. Like facing the final boss, this challenge will test everything you've learned.

Your mission? Complete 9 pronoun worksheets covering every type and usage.

Hunter Equipment

  • Pencil and determination
  • Pronoun reference chart
  • All your accumulated knowledge

Skills to Unlock

Power Standard PS15
The student will identify and use all pronouns correctly.

Training Scrolls

All Pronoun Types:

  • Subjective: I, you, he, she, it, we, they (act as subject)
  • Objective: me, you, him, her, it, us, them (receive action)
  • Possessive: my/mine, your/yours, his, her/hers, its, our/ours, their/theirs
  • Reflexive: myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, themselves (reflect back to subject)
  • Intensive: Same as reflexive but used for emphasis ("I myself will do it")

Dungeon Raid

Official Quest Instructions

Students will complete 9 comprehensive pronoun worksheets demonstrating mastery of all pronoun types.

Your Quest Materials

Intensive Pronouns - Writing Practice Intensive Pronouns - Circling Practice Objective Pronouns - Complete this worksheet Possessive Pronouns 1 - Complete this worksheet Possessive Pronouns 2 - Complete this worksheet Pronouns and Antecedents - Complete this worksheet Reflexive Pronouns - Writing Practice Reflexive Pronouns - Circling Practice Subjective Pronouns - Complete this worksheet

Raid Strategy Guide

Step 1: Review All Pronoun Types

Before starting, review the differences between all five pronoun types. Know when each type is used.

Step 2: Master Reflexive vs. Intensive

Reflexive: "I hurt myself" (necessary - reflects action back)
Intensive: "I myself made it" (emphatic - could be removed)

Step 3: Pronoun-Antecedent Agreement

Every pronoun must have a clear antecedent it refers to. "The team celebrated their victory" - "their" refers to "team."

Step 4: Work Systematically

Complete worksheets in order. Build your skills progressively from one type to the next.

Step 5: Double-Check Everything

This is the final challenge. Review each answer before moving on. Accuracy is key!

Guild Master Verification
